meanings.definition: The quality of being excessively refined or affected in manner or language.
meanings.sent1: Her preciosity in speech made it hard for others to relate to her.
meanings.sent2: The writer's preciosity in his prose made it difficult for readers to understand.
meanings.sent3: Despite his preciosity, he still managed to make friends with his genuine kindness.
meanings.sent4: The preciosity of her manners was like a delicate porcelain teacup, fragile yet beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The preciosity of the artwork was evident in every intricate brushstroke.

meanings.definition: Excessive refinement or affectation in manner or language.
meanings.sent1: The preciosity of her gestures made her seem out of touch with reality.
meanings.sent2: His writing was criticized for its preciosity, lacking the raw emotion readers craved.
meanings.sent3: The preciosity of his outfit at the party was so over-the-top that it became a conversation starter.
meanings.sent4: Her preciosity in decorating her room turned it into a whimsical wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The preciosity of his compliments felt insincere and rehearsed.
